subject: Business
title: The Pareto Principle in Business
description: A 60-second lesson on The Pareto Principle in Business.

hook.text: 80% of your revenue comes from 20% of your customers. Vilfredo Pareto noticed this pattern everywhere.

buildup.text: The 80/20 rule says a small number of inputs produce the majority of outputs in most systems.

discovery.text: 20% of bugs cause 80% of crashes. 20% of products generate 80% of sales. The pattern is remarkably consistent.

twist.text: Most companies spread resources evenly. The winners focus disproportionately on the vital few.

climax.text: Apple has a tiny product line compared to Samsung. Fewer products, more focus, higher margins.

punchline.text: Find the 20% that matters. Ignore the rest.

quiz.question: What does the Pareto Principle suggest?
options: A small percentage of inputs produces the majority of outputs
Focus should always be on cost reduction
